#Text=Cook Humba Pata
#Text=Humba pata is a classic Filipino stew .
#Text=To make this comforting dish , boil ham hocks until they soften a little .
#Text=Stir them into a pot with sautéed onions and garlic .
#Text=Then add bay leaves , pepper , pineapple juice , and soy sauce .
#Text=Simmer the mixture until the meat finishes cooking and the liquids become a flavorful sauce .
#Text=Stir in a little brown sugar and vinegar before you serve the humba pata with rice .
#Text=Ingredients
#Text=of ham hocks ( pata )
#Text=½ cup ( about 50 g ) of dried banana blossoms
#Text=1 pork bouillon cube
#Text=¼ cup ( 15 g ) of fermented , salted black beans ( tausi )
#Text=¼ cup ( 50 g ) of dark brown sugar
#Text=1 yellow onion
#Text=4 cloves garlic , crushed
#Text=3 dried bay leaves
#Text=½ teaspoon ( 1 g ) of crushed peppercorn
#Text=of pineapple
#Text=juice
#Text=of soy sauce
#Text=of vinegar
#Text=of water
#Text=of cooking oil such as vegetable , coconut , or canola oil
#Text=Makes 4 servings
#Text=Steps
#Text=Assembling the Humba Pata
#Text=Bring water to a boil over high heat .
#Text=Pour of water into a large pot and turn the burner to high heat .
#Text=The water should come to a vigorous boil .
#Text=Put a lid on the pot to make the water boil faster .
#Text=Boil of ham hocks ( pata ) for 40 to 60 minutes .
#Text=Once the water boils , lower the sliced ham hocks into the pot .
#Text=Turn the burner down to medium heat and cover the pot .
#Text=If it looks like too much water is evaporating as the ham hocks boil , add more water to the pot .
#Text=The ham hocks should become slightly tender , but it will finish cooking when you fry it .
#Text=Transfer the ham hocks to a plate .
#Text=Turn off the burner and use a large slotted spoon to scoop the boiled ham hocks out of the water .
#Text=Set the ham hocks on a plate or bowl and set them aside .
#Text=You can discard the water in the pot .
#Text=Sauté the onion and garlic over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes .
#Text=Pour of cooking oil into another pot and turn the burner to medium heat .
#Text=Once the oil shimmers , stir in 1 chopped onion and 4 cloves of crushed garlic .
#Text=Stir the onion and garlic frequently to prevent them from sticking to the bottom of the pot .
#Text=Add the ham hocks and cook them for 1 minute .
#Text=Put the boiled ham hocks into the pot with the onion and garlic .
#Text=Stir and cook the ham hocks over medium heat for 1 minute .
#Text=The ham hocks should brown a little as they sauté .
#Text=Simmering and Finishing the Humba Pata
#Text=Add the soy sauce , pineapple juice , and pork bouillon cube .
#Text=Pour of pineapple juice and of soy sauce into the pot .
#Text=Stir in 1 pork bouillon cube when the liquids begin to boil .
#Text=Keep stirring until the bouillon cube dissolves .
#Text=Stir in the bay , pepper , banana blossoms , and salted black beans .
#Text=Add 3 dried bay leaves , ½ teaspoon ( 1 g ) of crushed peppercorn , ½ cup ( about 50 g ) of dried banana blossoms , and ¼ cup ( 15 g ) of fermented , salted black beans .
#Text=Stir to incorporate the seasonings into the liquid .
#Text=Cover and simmer it for 20 minutes or until until the pork is cooked through .
#Text=Put the lid on the pot and reduce the burner to medium heat .
#Text=Let the liquid bubble gently so it reduces by half .
#Text=The pork should reach with a meat thermometer once it 's finished cooking .
#Text=Stir in the vinegar and brown sugar and cook it for 5 minutes .
#Text=Add ¼ cup ( 50 g ) of dark brown sugar and of vinegar to the pot .
#Text=Stir until the sugar dissolves and let the humba pata simmer for 5 more minutes .
#Text=Simmering the humba pata will help the flavors develop .
#Text=Serve the humba pata immediately .
#Text=Turn off the burner and scoop the humba pata into serving bowls .
#Text=Serve it with steamed white rice or flatbread .
#Text=Refrigerate the leftover humba pata in an airtight container for up to 3 or 4 days .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Humba pata becomes more flavorful when it 's made ahead and reheated .
#Text=Things
#Text=You 'll Need
#Text=Measuring cups and spoons
#Text=Large pot with lid
#Text=Slotted spoon
#Text=Knife and cutting board
#Text=Spoon
#Text=Serving bowl or plate
#Text=Meat thermometer
